body:
Why aren't the tests breaking if the erb is malformed?

> On May 26, 2014, at 14:08, Mike Subelsky notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> I'm getting the below error on sidekiq 3.1.2's web UI, whenever I view any queue - even if the queue has no jobs in it (and I've ruled out issues like an old version of sidekiq putting pre-3.1 jobs onto a queue that I then view with this UI)
> 
> 2014-05-26T21:06:18.285785+00:00 heroku[router]: at=info method=GET path=/queues/redacted host=REDACTED request_id=ce04ee3a-3a73-4a4d-9c13-fb7280056fd7 fwd="69.140.80.69" dyno=web.1 connect=0ms service=4ms status=500 bytes=358
> 2014-05-26T21:06:18.282853+00:00 app[web.1]: SyntaxError - /app/vendor/bundle/ruby/2.0.0/gems/sidekiq-3.1.2/web/views/queue.erb:24: syntax error, unexpected ';'
> 2014-05-26T21:06:18.282857+00:00 app[web.1]: ...a = msg.display_args.inspect -; @_out_buf.concat "\n"
> 2014-05-26T21:06:18.282859+00:00 app[web.1]: ...                               ^:
> 2014-05-26T21:06:18.282861+00:00 app[web.1]:    /app/vendor/bundle/ruby/2.0.0/gems/tilt-1.4.1/lib/tilt/template.rb:264:in `class_eval'
> 2014-05-26T21:06:18.282863+00:00 app[web.1]:    /app/vendor/bundle/ruby/2.0.0/gems/tilt-1.4.1/lib/tilt/template.rb:264:in`compile_template_method'
> 2014-05-26T21:06:18.282865+00:00 app[web.1]:    /app/vendor/bundle/ruby/2.0.0/gems/tilt-1.4.1/lib/tilt/template.rb:240:in `compiled_method'
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

not sure. this is Ruby 2.0 running on heroku, if that helps. Gemfile and lock below.

``` ruby
source "http://rubygems.org"
source ENV["SIDEKIQ_PRO_URL"]
ruby "2.0.0"

gem "slim"
gem "sidekiq"
gem "sidekiq-pro"
gem "unicorn"
gem 'sinatra', :require => nil
gem "sprockets"
gem "rack-ssl"
gem "rake"
gem "hirefire-resource"
```


hey @mperham ,
have you ever try to set trim mode in the App ? maybe theses trim problems could be solved at all.   

@subelsky  try it yourself just to verify if it helps you.  
find your sidekiq gem

```
  bundle list sidekiq
```

open in your editor the file in gem **sidekiq/web.rb** and insert this line   

```
     set :erb, { trim: '-' }
```

as below

```
module Sidekiq
  class Web < Sinatra::Base
    include Sidekiq::Paginator

    set :root, File.expand_path(File.dirname(__FILE__) + "/../../web")
    set :public_folder, Proc.new { "#{root}/assets" }
    set :views, Proc.new { "#{root}/views" }
    set :locales, ["#{root}/locales"]
    set :erb, { trim: '-' }   # < ------------------------------------------- HERE

    ......

```

Got it, I think it's something Rails configures globally: `ActionView::Base.erb_trim_mode='%<>-'` to activate all the trim options in ERB.  Notice that @subelsky isn't using Rails whereas my test suite does reference Rails.

Hey ! @mperham  amazing. Using  **set :erb, { trim: '-' }** didn't not work ?  
Sinatra uses Tilt, and every render it will initialize the proper engine and pass options.   

Nice work !
I just don't see a lot of point to using trim mode.  It's mostly to keep the html output "clean" but that's not a concern to me.  I'll take a PR to set trim mode like ActiveView's if you care.
I deployed 605d7d0 and the problem went away, thanks!

issue.title: Error in web interface

repository.name: sidekiq_status
repository.description: Extension to Sidekiq to pass job execution metadata such as status and result back to the client

issue.body:
